abilitygroupdescription.p: These abilities represent training in the use of staves, spears, halberds, bill hooks, glaives and other pole-arms in combat. Note that some abilities here cannot be used with some weapons, Polearm Hook requires a hook on the end of the pole to catch.

abilitydescription.p: Characters equipped with a polearm, but not a spear or staff, can use the hooked edge of this weapon to attempt to disarm an opponent or remove their shield.
If the character successfuly hits the attacker makes an opposed Strength test against the opponent. If successful the defender drops their weapon/shield.
Characters equipped with a spear, staff or polearm can strike with it during combat doing weapon damage.

Characters equipped with a spear or polearm can brace against a charge striking first and doing extra damage. To use this the attack must be directed at an opponent that is Charging in the direction of the character.

The character swings their weapon in large arcs keeping foes at bay. Opponents must make a Willpower check to attack and the character may roll to hit the first opponent who tries to do so in the round as a reaction. If successful the opponent cannot close to attack.
Note that this ability requires a reasonable amount of space to swing the weapon.

ability:staff.parry When a character is attacked they may attempt to parry the blow using their weapon instead of making an armour roll. This ability spends the characters reaction for the round. If the parry result fails and a boon is rolled the attack deals half damage. If the parry result fails and a bane is rolled the attack deals double damage. If the parry check succeeds the attack does no damage.
